Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate and identify two distinct habitats, one land-based (e.g., forest, garden) and one water-based (e.g., pond, lake).
The student can draw and label various types of living things in each habitat, such as trees, fish, and other plants and animals.
The student can compare and contrast the different types of living things in the two habitats through their drawings.
The student can demonstrate patterns of biodiversity in the natural world by showing diverse living organisms within each habitat.
The student can organize and present their observations clearly in their drawings to provide evidence for the diversity and patterns in plant and animal life across different habitats.
